intro: Psychotria molleri, commonly known as the "Amazonian psychotria," is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found in the understory of tropical rainforests. Psychotria molleri is also noted for its chemical composition, which includes various alkaloids, though it is not as well-studied as other species in the genus.
